result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelby L. Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 9:50 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1509, 22CF128.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty John Mathie. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CF128>>State moves to DRI Count 2 (Forgery-Uttering) and Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 

21CF1509 Count 1 (Theft-Business Setting >$10,000-$100,000)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF128 Count 1 (Forgery-Uttering)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 21CF1509: SWH for 6 years probation.
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.  Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing; amount to be paid at minimum of $250/month.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  No objection to early release of probation if all terms and conditions are met. 

COURT ORDERS on 22CF128:  4 months MCJ; concurrent with 21CF1509.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  COURT grants 2 days credit.  

COURT sets CC 9/07/22 at 8:05 a.m. to set restitution hearing.
